int f(int n) {
  if (n == 1) return 1;
  if (n == 2) return 2;
  
  int ret = 0;
  int pre = 2;

  for (int i = 3; i <= n; ++i) {

    pre = ret;
  }
  return ret;
}

int i;
public ListNode removeNthFromEnd(ListNode head, int n) {
if(head == null){
i=0;

i++;

return head;
}
}

public static SingleNode<Integer> mergeV2(SingleNode<Integer> nodeA, SingleNode<Integer> nodeB) {
SingleNode<Integer> result;

if (nodeA == null) {
return nodeB;
} else if (nodeB == null) {
return nodeA;
}

// æ‰¾å‡ºè¾ƒå°çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹
if (compareNode(nodeA, nodeB) <= 0) {
result = nodeA;
nodeA = nodeA.next;
} else {
result = nodeB;
nodeB = nodeB.next;
}

result.next = mergeV2(nodeA, nodeB);
return result;
}

int f(int n) {
if (n == 1) return 1;
return f(n-1) + 1;

public int f(int n) {
if (n == 1) return 1;
if (n == 2) return 2;
int n_1 = f(n - 1);
System.out.println("f(n-1=" + (n - 1) + ")=" + n_1);
int n_2 = f(n - 2);
System.out.println("f(n-2=" + (n - 2) + ")=" + n_2);
int m = n_1 + n_2;
System.out.println("f(n-1) + f(n-2) = " + m);
return m;
}

package com.leyb.demo.controller;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;
/**
* æœ€ç»ˆæ¨èäººç®€å•å®ç°ï¼ˆé€’å½’ï¼‰ï¼Œæœ‰é—®é¢˜è¿˜è¯·æŒ‡æ•™
* @author Administrator
*
*/
public class Demo1 {

static Map<String,String> map = new HashMap<String, String>();


public static String getpc(String id,int count) throws Exception {
if(count > 10) {
throw new Exception();
}
String pId = map.get(id);
if (pId == null) return id;
++ count;
return getpc(pId,count);
}

public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
map.put("A", "B");
map.put("B", "C");
map.put("C", "D");
map.put("D", "A");
String id = "B";
int count = 0;
String r = getpc(id,count);
System.out.println(r);
}

}

function goStep($n)
{
if ($n == 1) return 1;
if ($n == 2) return 2;
return goStep($n - 1) + goStep($n - 2);
}


// ä¼˜åŒ–
function doStep($n, &$hasSolved = [])
{
if ($n == 1) return 1;
if ($n == 2) return 2;

if (isset($hasSolved[$n])) {
return $hasSolved[$n];
}

$ret = doStep($n - 1, $hasSolved) + doStep($n - 2, $hasSolved);
$hasSolved[$n] = $ret;
return $ret;

int f(int n) {
if (n == 1) return 1;
if (n == 2) return 2;

int ret = 0;
int pre = 2;
int prepre = 1;
for (int i = 3; i <= n; ++i) {
ret = pre + prepre;
prepre = pre;
pre = ret;
}
return ret;
}

Leetcode 698. Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets
Given an array of integers nums and a positive integer k, find whether it's possible to divide this array into k non-empty subsets whose sums are all equal.

Example 1:
Input: nums = [4, 3, 2, 3, 5, 2, 1], k = 4
Output: True
Explanation: It's possible to divide it into 4 subsets (5), (1, 4), (2,3), (2,3) with equal sums.

private static int f1(int n){
Map<Integer,Integer> hasSolvedList = new HashMap<>();
if (hasSolvedList.containsKey(n)) {
return hasSolvedList.get(n);
}
if(n == 1){
return 1;
}
if (n == 2) {
return 2;
}
int ret = f1(n-1)+f1(n-2);
hasSolvedList.put(n, ret);
return ret;
}
